snippet: Bill Thompson made a gracious exit from the New York mayor’s race, but he called the lack of official results a disgrace. He’s right.
abstract: Editorial commends William Thompson Jr for his gracious withdrawal from New York City mayoral contest; supports his criticism of New York City Board of Elections for failing to deliver timely vote count; suggests Thompson join with fellow critics Michael R Bloomberg and Christine Quinn to push for reform of this abysmal system.
lead_paragraph: Bill Thompson made a gracious exit from the New York mayor’s race, but he called the lack of official results a disgrace. He’s right.
